documents.document: @Se_Railway would be good to announce that at London bridge. Why does this impact services all day long? Happened pre 6am
@Se_Railway so why can't I get home now? No information provided at all. Awful yesterday and awful today, couldn't get in nor out !
@Se_Railway why keep saying another is coming if there was no chance! Would have got a slow train 40mins ago if proper communication
Third world transport system
Frozen. 50 mins on the Orpington frozen platform. Apparently trains delayed by 6 min, gets to 1 min then cancelled. Why say 6mins !
@Se_Railway a single broken down train and nothing can get to London??? This isn't 1817
@tprstly not sure the Motorola flip mobile phone was 1973!!!!
@se_railway well done today, 6 coaches ... Greatly appreciated by all
@Se_Railway sending just 3 coaches for the 05.51 to charring x is just stupid. Should be 6 the amount of passengers standing every morning
What the hell is happening to democracy. Vote. Majority wins. Done. Don't dispute it if not what you wanted. #brexit #trump
@businessinsider @Daniel_Rubino Microsoft has been massively more innovative than Apple for the past few years.The gap is just getting wider
lots articles on MacBook pro interactive strip, looks pointless. Yet Surface Studio, a game changer, nothing. Tech journos are pointless
So today, didn't see any daylight! Train at 05.51, dark, work in the basement then home at 19.30, dark. I miss the sun!
Standing room only, all because you send just 4 carriages on the 05.51 from Orpington to Charring X. Send 6! @Se_Railway #billyBasic
Sometimes it's hard to see the light at the end of the tunnel, but when you do, you know the hard work was worth it. Getting there!
https://t.co/AOm1zsH4R2 come on Apple, a joke is a joke.
https://t.co/ZOsdhk4eIj today some basic economics are finally recognised!
Third world train infrastructure and trains. Too hot for signals and no air con. Utter joke
Enjoying SCRUM planning, in our SCRUM of SCRUMS .... #agile #productivity
Seems history has forgotten chemical allie? All those who died by the WMDs in Iraq. Maybe they never found any, as they were all used?
#Sad we forget #history so quickly. Remember 7/7? What about 9/11 and the events that lead to Iraq? The Somme and our battle for democracy?
Why is it so hard to get a train to run to time. Happened just once now this week! #southeasterntrains
Come on wales! Talent, drive, pride!
Glad Osborne seems to be staying on as chancellor. Need some continuity, and rightfully his focus is the economy, not #brexit negotiations
People have spoken, lets not debate it, lets get on with living with it and making the best. #democracy
Vote for #Brexit is a vote for democracy https://t.co/BQyoyTt5XT
If we Brexit, UK overnight becomes the EU biggest customer. Finally, power to negotiate and make our own way. Let's not waste June 23
In business, in sport and in life, your destiny in your own hands is what you strive for. Brexit is control and destiny in our own hands
Catching up on top gear. Should just have Jenson Button present everything!
Had a wonderful bank holiday weekend. Nothing more important than family!
Loved another #GoT episode, best show on T.V.!
As a spurs supporter, have to say we'll done to Leicester
Takeaway from yesterdays #FinTech talks. None of founders speaking understand actual tech, innovation or how its built. No clue. #sadFacts
Brilliant, Google safe browsing tools label https://t.co/iC4dHofnSY unsafe. Glad I'm sticking with Bing. Maybe a Yahoo come back?
Following on, yesterday fintech talk claimed no IT developer in a bank is innovative! Utter drivel comment Giles #Zopa
Fintech conference today, disappointed with comments from Zopa founder on actual tech. Should know Microsoft is massively innovative atm
Loving this in my drive...It has been a good weekend https://t.co/5J0QXSREWA
@surface have a surface pro 3, might go for the pro 4 shortly... Shall see
@surface really impressed with them. Great bit of kit, excellent with Azure Active Directory, and excellent as a tablet.
Nutter on the train this morning, not what you want at 6.30am
Seems a lot of financial based companies want to play on the fact they "not a bank". That's not good, means my money isn't protected #fscs
@thatscricket @jamestaylor20 Shocked and so sad to hear the news :( England will miss Taylor, no doubt!
Think the exec team will be happy with these. Have to say, simply stunning kit #SurfaceBook https://t.co/AHpiFjqynz
@hkanji @nuzzel @rishad clear from day one
So I turned the golf off just as Jordan got to the 12th. Ooppss. Missed all the drama, and shocked this morning. #EnglishMaster
Am I the only one who thinks the PayPal new money TV adds are simply awful?
Think Microsofts AI bot on twitter is unfortunately now a reflection of many users on twitter. Have to teach it who are just t**** & ignore
I see his point, but little harsh on people who are not savy, Granny for example https://t.co/HNt9RVVEjq
An exciting week so far. So much done, well done the team, sure we all need this bank holiday weekend!
Am I shocked? No. Not the first or last CEO to act like this #Powa #Administration https://t.co/bWK60sfemp
Commentary in the icc cricket world cup can be funny. Well placed! It was a wild slash that just went that way!
@Uni_of_essex looking forward to meeting this years IT graduates at project presentation day
Really wish people with colds and flu didnt come into work, sharing all that on the train and underground now means i feel ropey!
Have to say Chris Harris on Cars is exceptional. Guy really knows his stuff!
Have to say, I LOVE the new Aston Martin DB11...I want one...
Always great when you get back to the office and look through whats been developed in the past few weeks, and you're chuffed
First day back in the office after the South Africa break. Feels like a long old working day
South Africa is hot hot, though not to leave the hotel for a walk. Ahh. Lucky we have sub, swimming pool and everything we need
Two weeks away from the office. A needed break, but once I'm back, I know i will wish i hadnt had two weeks away due to the mountain!
A win is a win, but wasn't impressed with England, good start, so hopefully can build on that performance.
Trains are getting busier and busier! Thanks ðŸ˜ž
Full day of business processes today. Loving VISO it seems, oh and spreadsheets
Managed to watch Legend yesterday. Good film, like the way the story was told, Hardy was exceptional
Pleasent spin off from the weekend though, listening to Michael Jackson while working away, forgot how good his music was.
Still frustrated with incompetence of some individuals making me work longer on a weekend. #NotThatComplex!
A mixed bag of a weekend. Some great time with by little boy, but still a working weekend
Watched the bbc4 doco on Donald Campbell last night, what an inspirational man. Need more people like that
Great article today by Simon Sebag in @standardnews
@standardnews the tech firm IT shortage is due to firms not looking at the talent in UK UNIs. Simple as that
Just read tech firms want visa relaxed to grab IT workers from outside the UK. Utter joke, so much IT talent at our UNIs, actually look!
Love SCRUM day. Intense sprint coming up, but they are all going to be like that. #build
Stock market falls, petrol set to be sub 90p by April, just a matter of time before house market drops, or bursts!
Watched a lot of football for the first time in years and years today. Prem standard has dropped massively!
Amazed at Broad today. Top stuff! #StunningEngland
https://t.co/jnrb9NZGvY that's very interesting. Some people need to take note, work time is work, nothing is private
Corbyn politics upsetting the Labour MPs yet again...
Our propriatary built Adaptive Case Management platform for handling a lot of business processes is going very well. Worth the investment!
Windows 10 universal app, yes we will thankyou...First class experience across all win 10 devices, no matter form factor. Looking forward
Full on first day bk. Lots of doco, lots of exciting developments.
Office move today. No more silicone roundabout, fair thee well Shoreditch....
Do/can southeastern trains ever run to time? I've not experienced it once!
4.8m use London tube on one day. Gives context to any number based statements in politics I think

What is it with national rail journey planner, simply inventing trains that don't exist. Keep trying to catch trains that aren't real!
Even at a point that some staff really only need a Lumia mobile phone device, continuum, monitor and keyboard, that's them sorted!
Our office moving more to convertible devices with dock stations and multi monitors. Keeps costs down, raises productivity and flexibility
I truly believe convertible devices, like surface pro, like surface book and even new Lumia phones are changing the workplace landscape
Visually can see the ball move off of the bat! How is that given not out? On review even! #blind #England#cricket
Very much looking forward to this evenings CROWDIT launch event. Great work by these guys.
Surface Book sells out in all flavours. Good sign that Microsoft blending tablets with traditional laptops and desktops is the way forward

Five from five circle line journey failures. Does that line ever run properly?
Circle line is awful. Ribs about every ten mins, at best, then just sits at Aldgate for an additional five! Should be running every 2 mins!
Windows phone as a PC via a neat dock, almost full PC. enough for, mail, web and universal apps. That's innovation, business should love it
@hkanji we need cycle lanes. That's rather a narrow view of London life and public spending
VW boss tries to lay blame with a few software engineers! Utter disgrace, they develop what they are specified too! Utter lies.
After the Google and Apple events, have to say Microsoft is showing they are the innovators right now. #impressed
